title: Living Skills Training
shortDescription: Comprehensive living skills training for children with autism in Hyderabad. Daily living skills, vocational training, and independence building at our Banjara Hills center.
description: Maryam Child Development Studio offers comprehensive living skills training in Hyderabad for children and teenagers with autism and developmental disabilities. Our program at Banjara Hills focuses on activities of daily living (ADLs), vocational skills, community integration, and independence training. We prepare individuals for successful adult life, serving families across Hyderabad including Jubilee Hills, Gachibowli, Madhapur, and Kondapur.

approach.title: Activities of Daily Living (ADL) Training
approach.description: Teaching essential self-care skills including personal hygiene, dressing, grooming, and household chores for independence in Hyderabad homes.

approach.title: Vocational Skills Development
approach.description: Job readiness training, work skills, and vocational preparation for employment opportunities in Hyderabad's job market.

approach.title: Community Integration
approach.description: Teaching safe navigation of Hyderabad community spaces, public transportation, shopping, and social interactions in real-world settings.

approach.title: Money Management
approach.description: Practical training in handling money, budgeting, banking, and making purchases - essential skills for independent living in Hyderabad.

faqs.question: What age group is living skills training for?
faqs.answer: Our living skills program in Hyderabad is designed for teenagers and young adults aged 13-21 years with autism and developmental disabilities, focusing on transition to adult life.

faqs.question: Do you provide vocational training in Hyderabad?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer vocational skills training including job readiness, work skills, and employment preparation at our Banjara Hills center, with connections to employers in Hyderabad.

faqs.question: Is community-based training included?
faqs.answer: Yes, our program includes community outings in Hyderabad to practice real-world skills like shopping, using public transport, and navigating community spaces safely.

faqs.question: How long is the living skills program?
faqs.answer: The program duration varies based on individual goals, typically ranging from 6 months to 2 years. We serve families from Jubilee Hills, Gachibowli, and across Hyderabad.
